metadata.title: CVE-2024-44995 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium
metadata.description: In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:net: hns3: fix a deadlock problem when config TC during resettingWhen config TC during the reset process, may cause a deadlock, the flow isas below:                             pf reset start                                 ?                                 ?                              ......setup tc                         ?    ?                            ?    ?                      DOWN: napi_disable()napi_disable()(skip)             ?    ?                            ?    ?                            ?  ......                      ......    ?                            ?    ?                            ?napi_enable()                    ?                                 ?                           UINIT: netif_napi_del()                                 ?                                 ?                              ......                                 ?                                 ?                           INIT: netif_napi_add()                                 ?                                 ?                              ......                 global reset start                                 ?                      ?                                 ?                      ?                           UP: napi_enable()(skip)    ......                                 ?                      ?                                 ?                      ?                              ......                 napi_disable()In reset process, the driver will DOWN the port and then UINIT, in thiscase, the setup tc process will UP the port before UINIT, so cause theproblem. Adds a DOWN process in UINIT to fix it.
